page.title: 19Bradford Abbas Church part 2
page.content: {Religion and local history.}The clock in Bradford Abbas church was presented to the parish in Jubilee year 1897 by Edward and Albert Clayton in memiry of their parents. William Clayton was Lord of the Manor and Lay Rector, he died in 1894. Just outside the west door are the remains of a 15th century cross. The inside of the church is divided into 6 areas: the nave, organ chamber, chancel, south vestry, south {chapel and the west tower. The Holy {Communion service begins at 10:15a.m. {and the family service at 11:00a.m. The church was built in the 13th. century. There are about 200 graves in the churchyard. There are 4 doors leading into the church of Bradford Abbas.
